questions.question: The power factor angle of a purely inductive circuit is: ?

explanations.d: In a pure inductive circuit, the current lags the voltage by 90 degrees. The power factor is the cosine of the angle between the voltage and the current. If the angle is 90, then cos(90) = 0. Hence, the power factor is zero.

questions.question: The power factor of capacitive circuits is:?

explanations.a: Capacitive circuits have a leading power factor because the current leads the voltage.

questions.question: What is the effect of a low power factor on an electrical system?

explanations.a: A low power factor increases the current required for the same amount of useful power, leading to higher losses in the system.

questions.question: Which of the following components can improve the power factor of an inductive load?

explanations.c: A capacitor can counteract the lagging current of an inductive load, thus improving the power factor.

questions.question: What is the formula for calculating the apparent power (S) in an AC circuit?

explanations.b: This formula represents the relationship between real power (P), apparent power (S), and power factor (PF).
explanations.c: The apparent power (S) is the product of voltage (V) and current (I).
explanations.d: All the formulas correctly define the relationship involving apparent power.
